entry.title: How to integrate a middleware program into SAP or is it possible to upload the middleware to SAP
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I m supposed to make a mobile application that sends data to SAP tables. As far as I search it is possible to do with OData, Gateway and BAPI structures. 

I already made the mobile app, it sends data as a json file to a middleware program which written in node.js. The idea behind not sending data directly from app to SAP and using middleware is security issues and being sure that all datas are in the right type and right column to add.

As I said the mobil app is ready, it sends a json file to a middleware. The middleware is also ready, it converts datas in json file to corresponding fields of tables and will send them to Gateway. My priority is uploading that middleware to SAP system and run it from there if it is possible. If it is not then I have to upload it to another server I guess. Did anyone has experienced or heard a structure like that? Is it possible to upload a node.js middleware into SAP and run it directly from there?

entry.title: Re: Extend Custom Purchase Order API Custom Fields to Sto...
entry.content:
Good day @Rawel 

Thank you for your question.

Here are some references to guide you.

API_PURCHASEORDER_2, Operations for Purchase Order, Stock Transfer Using Stock Transport Order,

SAP KBA 3110493

Based on your description, it seems the API cannot recognise your extension field in the STO context.

To summarise, in public cloud, updating custom fields on Purchase Orders works only for standard order types (e.g., NB) through API_PURCHASORDER_PROCESS_SRV. For Stock Transport Orders (type UB), the system uses a different API (API_STOCKTRANSORDER_PROCESS_SRV), which currently does not support custom fields extensions.

That means, when you send custom field values in your update payload, the system returns 422 unprocessable entity because those fields are not recognised in the STO data model. You can workaround this while adhering to the clean-core compliance and preventing integration failure by:

  • Skipping custom field updates for UB types in your integration logic
  • Maintaining STO-related extension data in a side table or CBO and link it to the PO number

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Forms Service by Adobe Technical Configuration Overview
entry.content:
In modern SAP landscapes, generating consistent, branded, and compliant business documents across heterogeneous environments is a recurring requirement. SAP Forms Service by Adobe (ADS) enables the dynamic rendering of print and interactive PDF forms, providing a unified document generation capability across SAP S/4HANA, SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), and on-premise systems. This blog provides a technical overview and configuration guide for connecting SAP Forms Service by Adobe on BTP and S/4HANA RISE PCE.

 

1. Architecture Overview

The SAP Forms Service by Adobe (ADS) can be consumed under several deployment models depending on your landscape. The integration is defined by how the ABAP system communicates with the ADS instance running in BTP.

1.1 Cloud Applications (via REST API)
Cloud-native applications can directly call the SAP Forms REST API to render forms dynamically using service configuration UIs. 

 

1.2 ABAP Applications on BTP
ABAP apps running in the BTP ABAP environment can call the service through standard integration methods.

1.3 S/4HANA On-Premise Systems

On-premise systems connect to the service through SAP Cloud Connector, which enables secure communication between the backend and the BTP-based forms service.

 

2. Restrictions

Type

Max File Size (per File)

Font file

25 MB

Customer XDC/XCI files

2 MB

Job profiles

1 MB

Credential/certificates/CRLs

5 MB

Data migration (.zip)

150 MB

Type

Max Storage Size (Total Volume)

Fonts

150 MB

XDC/XCI

20 MB

Job profiles

5 MB

Type

Max. Size

Storage size for error PDFs

10 MB

Size for destination cache

15 MB

Form template size for rendering

data size for attaching to PDF

20 MB

Input PDF size for PDF operations

10 MB

SAP Forms Service Support Fonts

  • OpenType¬Æ (.otf)
  • TrueType¬Æ (.ttf)
  • PostScript¬Æ Type 1 (.pfb)

Supported Versions

  • S/4HANA: 1809 SP8+, 1909 SP6+, 2020 SP4+, 2021 or higher
  • NetWeaver: 7.50 SP24 or higher
  • ABAP Environment on SAP BTP

 

3. Prerequisites and Setup

3.1 Configuring BTP

  • Create a Subaccount
  • Subscribe to the SAP Forms Service
  • Create a REST API Instance
  • Create a Service Instance for ABAP or On-Premise Integration
  • Assign Roles

Refer to this for more details: Initial Steps in Your SAP BTP Subaccount

3.2 Configuring ADS in S/4 HANA On-Premise

  • User Management - Transaction SU01
  • RFC Destination Setup - Transaction SM59
  •  CF Service Activation -Transaction SICF

Refer to this for more details: Connecting the SAP Forms Service to ABAP

 

Conclusion

The SAP Forms Service by Adobe (ADS) forms a critical component in modern SAP system architectures where hybrid or fully cloud-based landscapes require centralized document rendering. Unlike traditional on-premise ADS setups embedded in Java stacks, the BTP-hosted ADS model decouples rendering logic from the application layer, offering better scalability, resilience, and version control across environments.

From a technical standpoint, correct configuration of RFC destinations, ICF nodes, and SAP Cloud Connector mappings is essential for ensuring stable communication between S/4HANA (on-premise or RISE PCE) and the BTP ADS service. System administrators should also validate SSL certificates, maintain trusted connections to BTP subaccounts, and regularly test the ADS endpoint availability using standard reports.

 

SAP Forms service by Adobe

entry.title: Sorting and aggregation in the SAP Adobe form using scripting language
entry.content:
Requirement:
Display only one record per invoice number, even if the invoice contains multiple items. The displayed record should show the total (summed) amount of all items belonging to that invoice.

Assumption:
The internal table containing the invoice data is already extracted and correctly bound to the form context, ensuring that the data is displayed accurately in the output.

Scenario:
To illustrate this case, we are using sample data from the invoice item table (DFKKINVDOC_I), which stores all item-level details for each invoice number.



Now, let's try to generate the PDF and see the output.

Observe that some of the invoice numbers are already sorted but some are not and hence we need to sort the records according to the invoice number. Sorting and aggregation are two steps, hence we will see one by one each step to fulfill the requirements.

Solution:

Sorting and aggregation can easily be achieved using ABAP code in on-premise systems. However, since we are working in the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, we need to perform these operations using a scripting language.
In this case, we‚Äôll use JavaScript within the Adobe Form.

Step 1:- Sorting the records first will help us perform the aggregation correctly later.

  • Select the Table in the form layout.

  • Go to the Events tab.

  • Choose the form:ready event.

  • Set the Language to JavaScript.

Step 2:- Write the JavaScript Code for Sorting

Now, write the JavaScript code inside the form:ready event to sort the table records based on the invoice number.

var count = xfa.resolveNodes("GT_INVOICE.DATA[*]").length; // Get the number of records in the table
var table = this.DATA; // Access the Data node of the table
var i = 0; // Iteration for the outer loop
var j = 0; // Iteration for the inner loop
var intialInvoice; // Initial invoice number for which we need to find the duplicate invoice
var duplicateInvoice; // Duplicate invoice number corresponding to the initial invoice

for ( i = 0; i <= count - 1; i++ ){
      intialInvoice = xfa.resolveNode("GT_INVOICE.DATA["+ i +"]").INVDOCNO.rawValue;
      for ( j = i + 1; j <= count - 1; j++ ){
             duplicateInvoice = xfa.resolveNode("GT_INVOICE.DATA["+ j +"]").INVDOCNO.rawValue;
            // if the invoice number is greater, then move the instance( replace the instance of ith index and jth index)
                if ( intialInvoice > duplicateInvoice ) {
                      table.instanceManager.moveInstance(j, i);
                      }
               }
        }

Step 3:- Test the Sorting

Generate the PDF and verify if the data is now sorted by invoice number.

You should observe that the invoice numbers are displayed in sorted order.

Step 4:- Aggregate the Amounts for Each Invoice

The next step is to aggregate the total amount for each invoice.

In the same form:ready event of the GT_INVOICE, add the JavaScript code that compares invoice numbers and sums up the amounts for matching records.
Since the data is already sorted, the loop can safely exit once a non-matching invoice number is found, improving performance.

 

Generate the PDF again and verify that the aggregation works as expected.

You should now see the aggregated amount displayed for each invoice number (refer to the previous screenshot of sorted data for comparison).
The total amount for each invoice appears in the Amount field of the first record for that invoice ‚Äî this happens because our JavaScript logic updates only the first instance.

Step 5:- Display Only One Record per Invoice

Although the aggregation is correct, multiple line items of the same invoice are still visible.
We now need to hide the duplicate invoice entries and display only one record per invoice ‚Äî the one containing the aggregated value.

To achieve this, enhance the JavaScript code in the same form:ready event to suppress duplicate invoice records.
Below is the updated JavaScript code snippet that performs both aggregation and duplicate removal.

 

i = 0;   // reset the value of i to 0
j = 0;   // reset the value of j to 0
var previousInvoice;
var sum = 0;
 
 for ( i = 0; i <= count - 1; i++ ){ 
       initialInvoice = xfa.resolveNode("GT_INVOICE.DATA["+ i +"]").INVDOCNO.rawValue; 
      // initially the previousInvoice is empty and hence we need to put 
      // the invoice number of first iteration of for loop
      if ( previousInvoice == null || previousInvoice == "Empty" || previousInvoice == " "  ){
            previousInvoice = xfa.resolveNode("GT_INVOICE.DATA["+ i +"]").INVDOCNO.rawValue;
       }
      
      if ( ( previousInvoice != null ) && ( previousInvoice == initialInvoice ) ){
                   
          // catch the first iteration of an invoice number from the sorted list
          // counting the number of matching records because we need to hide the other duplicate values
          // only the first iteration of any invoice needs to be retained
          if ( countIteration == '0' ){
               indexValue = i;
          }
          else {
             xfa.resolveNode("GT_INVOICE.DATA["+ i +"]").presence = "hidden";
          }
          countIteration = countIteration + 1;
          
       // add the amounts of matching invoice numbers
       sum = sum + xfa.resolveNode("GT_INVOICE.DATA["+ i +"]").BETRW.rawValue;
      }
      else if( ( previousInvoice != null ) && ( previousInvoice != initialInvoice ) ){
           // here the new invoice number is found and hence the previousInvoice needs to be changed
           // also the sum of amount of earlier invoice number should be updated
           
           xfa.resolveNode("GT_INVOICE.DATA["+ indexValue +"]").BETRW.rawValue = sum;
           
           // now reset the value of sum, indexValue and countIteration
           sum = 0;
           indexValue = 0;
           countIteration = 0;
           
           previousInvoice = xfa.resolveNode("GT_INVOICE.DATA["+ i +"]").INVDOCNO.rawValue;
           
           // Capture the first iteration of the new invoice number
           indexValue = i;
           // Do the sum of the new invoice number
           sum = sum + xfa.resolveNode("GT_INVOICE.DATA["+ indexValue +"]").BETRW.rawValue;
           // increase the iteration counter since the first iteration index has already been captured
           countIteration = countIteration + 1;
           
      }
        
      // check the last iteration of the loop
      // last record should be considered separately
       if ( i == count - 1 ) {
            xfa.resolveNode("GT_INVOICE.DATA["+ indexValue +"]").BETRW.rawValue = sum;
       }
   }

Step 6: Test the Final Output

Generate the PDF once again and verify the output.
You should now see only one record per invoice, each displaying the aggregated amount value.

Please find the attached Javascript code in the text file below for the reference.

Final Result 

The data is now sorted correctly based on the invoice number and also we see only one record of each item with the aggregated amount is being displayed.

Please let me know if you have any suggestions or any other solution for such requirements.

 

Thanks,
Shubham

entry.title: Step-by-step guide: Attaching documents to a Bill of Materials and making them visible in Production
entry.content:
Bill of Materials is a master data which we use to maintain the components of the end product. For example, in order to produce a bicycle, we require saddle, handlebar assembly, chain and others. Taking this as example, for some cases, a drawing document of the bicycle may be included as BoM. In manufacturing environments, it‚Äôs common to have technical documents such as drawings, specifications, or quality instructions that need to be accessible during production. 

SAP Document Management System (DMS) allows us to link such documents directly to the Bill of Materials (BOM), ensuring they‚Äôre visible in production or process orders under Document Link section.

This blog explains step by step how to attach a document in a BOM and automatically display it in the production order.

First step: To create Attachment/ Document (SAT type) via Create Document: Initial Screen (CV01N)

Prerequisite: Document type must be linked with PORDER object in SPRO.

Configuration Path:

 SPRO ‚Üí SAP Customizing Implementation Guide ‚Üí Cross-Application Components ‚Üí Document Management ‚Üí Control Data ‚Üí Define Document Type ‚Üí (Select Document Type) ‚Üí Define Object Links.

For example, here I used SAT document type.

 

Second step: To set the document to Release(H3) in Document Data Tab via CV01N/CV02N

Prerequisite: Original must be stored.

For the context, the Original above refers to the source document or the primary file that can be in any type such as PDF, word, text file, etc and is stored in document info record. 

Now, back to the prerequisite steps as following.
1) In the Change Document screen, click on Originals tab and check if the original has been stored.
2) The, click on activate button to ativate the original.

Next, go to the tab Document Data and change the Document Status to H3 (Released).

Third step: To attach the Document in the BOM (CS01/CS02)
Open transaction CS01 (Create BOM) or CS02 (Change BOM) and then navigate to General -> Item.

On the Change material BOM:Item:General Data screen, follow the steps as below:

  • Set Item Category = D (Document), then press Enter.
  • Assign the required Document Number, Document Type, and Document Part/Version if applicable.

After assigning, the attached document will appear in the Document tab. Double click on the Document, it will open the Document page where we can view the attachment.

Go to Original tab to see attachment. Click on attachment to view.

Fourth step: To check the changes in BOM and update them in C223 for production version.

Fifth Step: To create Production/Process Order manually (CO01)
Then, on the screen Production order Create: Header, go to Documents tab

On the screen Production Order Create: Document Links, click on Bill of Material tab.


After clicking the Bill of Material tab, the attached document is automatically assigned in the production order.


In conclusion, in order to have the document attachment to be passed to production order, a combination of DMS and BoM need to be done.  It will make it easier for the users to review or check the documents if we link it directly to production order under Document Link section rather than to have to check the BoM. Other than that, these procedures surely will enhance transparency and improve manufacturing execution efficiency.

entry.title: Project Manager Only WBS Changes via custom CDS Views and Enterprise Project Validation BAdI
entry.content:
Introduction:

This guide shows how to enforce a validation in S/4HANA Public Cloud so that only the project manager of a project can change its WBS elements. We will combine Custom CDS Views to derive the project manager and the Enterprise Project Cloud BAdI to implement the validation at runtime.

Standard behaviour:

In the standard Project Control ‚Äì Enterprise Projects app (F3215), any user with the role SAP_BR_PROJ_FIN_CONTROLLER or assigned the roles like Project FIN Controller or project manager can modify projects and project elements; there is no built-in check to restrict changes to only assigned roles like project manager.

SAP provides several released CDS views for enterprise projects, such as:

  • I_EnterpriseProject
  • I_EnterpriseProjectTeamMember
  • I_EntProjectEntitlement
  • I_EnterpriseProjectRole

However, none of these exposes the project manager directly, so we will build a custom CDS view to identify who the project manager is per project.

Prerequisites:

You need the following business roles to develop and test this solution:

 Business Role

Business Role ID

Extensibility Specialist

SAP_BR_EXTENSIBILITY_SPEC

Project Financial Controller

SAP_BR_PROJ_FIN_CONTROLLER

 

If you do not have these roles, ask your administrator to assign them, or, if you are the administrator, follow the  Maintain Business Users guide.

For debugging Cloud BAdIs, you may also need:

Business Role

Business Role ID

Application Support Engineer - Development Support

SAP_BR_APPL_SUP_ENG_DEV_SUP

Application Support Engineer

SAP_BR_APPL_SUPPORT_ENGINEER

For general background on BAdI debugging, see the blog  Generate Customer Project Id via BAdI Project Determination (/S4PPM/PROJECT_DETERMINATION_2).

Development Overview:

  1. Create a custom CDS view that joins project entitlements with team members and roles to expose the project manager.
  2. Create a project manager view that resolves the business user.
  3. Implement the Enterprise Project validation BAdI to block changes to WBS elements by non‚Äìproject managers.

Step 1 Create Custom CDS view that joins project entitlements with team members and roles

Open the APP: Custom CDS Views (Fiori ID: F1866A)

  • Name: YY1_ProjectTeamEntitlement
  • Scenario: Standard CDS view
  • Primary Data Source: I_EntProjectEntitlement

Add Associated Data Source:  I_EnterpriseProjectTeamMember, I_EnterpriseProjectRole, I_EnterpriseProject.

 

The overview data source is as follows: 

Notes:

- I_EntProjectEntitlement is required; without it, the link between the team member and the role will be missing.

- When joining I_EntProjectEntitlement and I_EnterpriseProjectTeamMember, include both ProjectUUID and TeamMemberUUID in the join.

- Include Role Category to filter for the project manager for the next step.

- Include BusinessPartnerUUID to retrieve project manager details.

 

 

Step2: Create the Project Manager view:

  • Name: YY1_ProjectManager
  • Scenario: Standard CDS view
  • Primary Data Source: YY1_ProjectTeamEntitlement

Add Associated Data Source:  I_BusinessUserBasic.

Define filters so that only project managers are returned:

 

You can preview the data to verify that the correct project manager information is exposed per project:

Step3: Implement Enterprise Project Validation BADI

Open APP: Custom Logic (Fiori ID: F6957)

Create Custom Logic implementation with:

  • Business Context: Project Element
  • Select ID: /S4PPM/PROJ_ELMNT_VALIDATION

 

* Example code for Project Manager validation

  DATA(current_user) = cl_abap_context_info=>get_user_technical_name( ).

  SELECT SINGLE * FROM YY1_ProjectManager WITH PRIVILEGED ACCESS

     WHERE projectuuid = @enterpriseprojectelement-projectuuid

*       AND userID = @Current_User

      INTO @DATA(l_ProjectManager).

  IF l_ProjectManager-userId <> current_user.

      APPEND INITIAL LINE TO validationmessages ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_validationmessage>).

      <ls_validationmessage>-systemmessageclass     = '/S4PPM/VAL_DET'.

      <ls_validationmessage>-systemmessagetype    = 'E'.

      <ls_validationmessage>-systemmessagenumber  = '000'.

      <ls_validationmessage>-systemmessagevariable1 = 'WBS can only changed by Project Manager'.

  ENDIF.

 

This logic fetches the current technical user, looks up the project‚Äôs manager from YY1_ProjectManager, and raises an error if the current user is not the project manager.

 

Conclusion

This walkthrough demonstrates how to restrict WBS element changes to the assigned project manager in S/4HANA Public Cloud. By deriving the project manager through custom CDS views and enforcing the rule via the Enterprise Project validation BAdI, you can add a targeted control that is not available in standard functionality.

entry.title: Re: Import Supplier Invoice template - XREF1 and XREF2 no...
entry.content:
Hi @miazafirah ,

The public cloud version is based on a ‚Äúwhitelisted API‚Äù concept. Only fields released by SAP for business extensibility are available in templates and OData services.
XREF1 and XREF2 are considered technical reference fields in FI documents and are not yet released for business use in the supplier invoice upload interface.

Option 1 ‚Äì Use Custom Fields & Logic (Recommended)
‚Ä¢ Go to App: Custom Fields and Logic.
‚Ä¢ Business Context: Supplier Invoice Header or Supplier Invoice Item.
‚Ä¢ Add fields (e.g., ‚ÄúReference Key 1‚Äù, ‚ÄúReference Key 2‚Äù).
‚Ä¢ Mark available in UI, OData, and Excel Template.
‚Ä¢ Publish ‚Üí Fields appear in upload template and Create Invoice app.

Option 2 ‚Äì Extend API / Communication Scenario
‚Ä¢ Extend SAP_COM_0057 with custom fields created above.
‚Ä¢ Regenerate communication arrangement.
‚Ä¢ Use extended fields in integration interface (API or upload).

Option 3 ‚Äì Use Journal Entry Upload App
‚Ä¢ If your requirement is purely FI posting with XREF1/XREF2 values (not MM invoices), use App: Import General Journal Entries.
‚Ä¢ This app supports XREF1 and XREF2 fields directly.

Option 4 ‚Äì Submit SAP Influence Request
‚Ä¢ Request SAP to expose XREF1/XREF2 in Supplier Invoice Import API/template.
‚Ä¢ Submit via Customer Influence Portal for S/4HANA Cloud.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: When the PO (purchase order) amount is lower than the...
entry.content:
HI @easap ,

Follow below steps.

-Create PO for 9 (ME21N).
-Goods Receipt for PO = 9 (MIGO). ‚Üí posts GR/IR liability for 9.
-Vendor posts invoice for 10 against the PO (MIRO). ‚Üí system posts invoice price variance (if allowed) or blocks the invoice if variance tolerance exceeded.
-Vendor issues credit note for 1; you post the vendor credit memo referencing the PO / invoice (MIRO ‚Äî ‚ÄúCredit memo‚Äù) or you post a reversing invoice.
-System clears GR/IR and vendor open items so net payable = 9 and inventory/expense value = 9 (depending on configuration).

entry.title: Re: Any differences in functionality in Finance between S...
entry.content:
HI @Susana1 ,

Here‚Äôs a clean tabular comparison between SAP S/4HANA 2023 On-Premise and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, focused on Finance (FI/GL/CO) functionality and related aspects.

 

AreaS/4HANA 2023 On-PremiseS/4HANA Cloud Private EditionRemarks
Core Finance (FI/GL)Fully available with complete configuration flexibility.Fully available with same functional scope.Both share the same code line for Finance.
COPA / PROF_ Fields*Standard COPA functionality; custom fields and extensions possible.Includes same COPA functions, plus may receive earlier or additional enhancements.Cloud Private may receive innovations faster.
Controlling (CO)Full CO capabilities with flexible customizing.Same CO functions available, aligned with clean-core principles.Functional parity, but approach to customization differs.
Embedded Analytics / AIAvailable, but some innovations come later.Some innovations (AI, predictive accounting) available earlier or exclusively.Cloud-first innovation strategy.
Universal JournalFully supported.Fully supported.No difference.
Parallel Ledgers / Multi-GAAPSupported.Supported.Identical functionality.
Custom Fields & ExtensionsUnlimited flexibility via classic ABAP, modifications, and user exits.Allowed through extensibility framework, but with restrictions to maintain clean core.On-premise offers deeper modification options.
Integration with BTP / Cloud ServicesOptional; customer-managed.Tight integration with SAP BTP services out of the box.Cloud Private is designed for hybrid integration.
Upgrades & Release ManagementFully controlled by customer; upgrade anytime.Managed by SAP; regular release schedule with limited control over timing.On-premise allows more flexibility.
Infrastructure ResponsibilityCustomer/partner-hosted; full system control.SAP or hyperscaler-hosted; managed infrastructure.Cloud Private reduces IT operations effort.
Security & ComplianceCustomer controls all policies and patches.Managed by SAP with standardized security and compliance.Cloud Private provides stronger compliance assurance.
Add-ons / Industry SolutionsAll legacy and partner add-ons supported.Most available, but some legacy ones may not be certified for Cloud.Verify compatibility before migration.
Performance OptimizationFully under customer control.Optimized by SAP under managed infrastructure.Similar results, but control differs.
TCO / Cost ModelHigher upfront investment (CAPEX model).Subscription-based (OPEX model) with predictable costs.Cloud Private reduces infrastructure and upgrade costs.
Innovation Adoption SpeedCustomer-driven; slower adoption cycle.SAP-driven; faster access to new functionality.Cloud-first development focus.
Extension PolicyTraditional ABAP allowed.Must follow clean-core and side-by-side extensions via BTP.Different development approach required.
Typical Customer ProfileComplex landscapes, heavy customization, industry-specific needs.Customers wanting cloud benefits with on-premise-like flexibility.Decision depends on governance and control needs.


If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Automated Alerts for Data Action Failures in SAC
entry.content:
Introduction

As a standard feature, SAP Analytics Cloud sends the alerts/ notification  for Data Management job failures whereas for the Data Actions  there is no such alert mechanism, and it requires manual monitoring to track the status of process.

For Instance,  We need to go through the entire  " Data Action Monitor"  to check the Data Action status that we triggered as part of nightly runs. it would be complicated to check the status of each and every DA whether it is failed or successful.

To make this process easier ,

  • The solution involves creating an automated routine through SAC Analytic Apps by utilizing the system models containing the status of the Data Actions .
  • Scheduling the routines at a regular interval so that it monitors the status of DA process and triggers an alert to Admins or the specified SAC users in case of any status other than ‚ÄúSUCCESS‚Äù

Details of the objects used in Implementation

SAP Live System Model    :  PLANNING_DATA_ACTIONS ( Path: Files| System/ Common/ SAC Content/ SAC Content Performance/ SAC Content Performance- Models )

Table_1                                 :     Acts as a source within  the application

Note: 1.This model stores all the data action details in SAC tenant with default time zone :GMT

2. Assuming that we trigger this run this application for every 20 mins through a Calendar publication, so it will send an alert if it finds a failures within the interval

3. Drag all the quired columns to the table considering  " Final Status" as the first row

 

# OnInitialization
var curr_date = new Date(Date.now()); //Get the current Date
console.log(curr_date);

var l_date1 = new Date(Date.now());
var l_date2 = new Date(Date.now());
var min= l_date2.getMinutes();
var hr = l_date2.getHours();
var hr2= hr+4; // Converting the EST hours to GMT
var hr3= hr+4;
var min2 = min-20;// Setting up the mins as per the required interval
// Handling the exceptional case
if(min2<0){
	min2= min + 40;
	hr2= hr2-1;
	console.log(min2);
	console.log(hr2);

	if(hr2<0){
		hr2= 23;
	}
}



l_date2.setMinutes(min2);
l_date2.setHours(hr2);
l_date1.setHours(hr3);
// Setting up the range to filter out the source table
var range = TimeRange.create(TimeRangeGranularity.Minute,l_date2,l_date1);

Table_1.getDataSource().setDimensionFilter("DATETIME_EXECUTE", range);
console.log(range);

var count= 0;
var dims = Table_1.getDimensionsOnRows()[0]; //With assumption that the status column is in the first row
var selections = Table_1.getDataSource().getDataSelections();
var members = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string);
// Formatting the table to print in the alert email
var strTable = "--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br> ";
    strTable = "<b>Data Action Name          |   Model Name         |   Process Type                   |   Triggered From              |   Execution Time            |   Status        </b><br>";
strTable = strTable + "--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br> ";
for( var j=0;j<selections.length;j++){
	var member =Table_1.getDataSource().getResultMember(dims,selections[j]);
	{
		members.push(member.description);}}
//console.log(members);
for (var s=0; s<members.length;s++){
	if(members[s]!=="Success"){
		count++;
// Pushing the table details to the format table after filtering out the failed DA details			
	strTable = strTable + "<b>" + count.toString() + ".</b>   "	 + selections[s]["PLANNING_PROCESS_NAME"] + "         |   "+ selections[s]["MODEL_NAME"] +"           |   "+ selections[s]["PLANNING_PROCESS_TYPE"] +"           |   "+ selections[s]["TRIGGERED_FROM_NAME"] +"           |   " + selections[s]["DATETIME_EXECUTE"].substr(0,16) +"        |   " + selections[s]["STATUS_DESC"] +"<br>" ;
	strTable = strTable + "------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br> ";
		
		
	}
}


console.log(count);
if(count>0){
Application.sendNotification({title: "ALERT: SAC Calendar Sequence Failure Notification", 
							  content:"This is a standard notification on your calendar tasks failure (Data Action or Multi-Action). Refer to the list below for the Tasks/Actions that have failed and take appropriate action to resolve the error.<br> <br>"+"Thanks,<br>"+"SAC Monitoring Process <br><br>"+ strTable + "<br>" ,
							  isSendMobileNotification:true,
							  isSendEmail:true,
							
							  receivers:["SAC User1","User2"]});
	
	
}

Since this code is being written on OnInitialization runs through the Calendar publication and send alert emails

Sample Email Alert:

Benefits

  • Business user to be benefitted by reduced lead time for Data action error remediation; automated email-failure notifications to Admins will result in immediate remediation effort
  • Reduced Manual monitoring effort through automation of alert notifications to SAC Admins on Daily/nightly loads.

Conclusion

This automation in SAC reduces manual monitoring, ensures timely intervention.

entry.title: Re: How to connect to onpremise fiori system based on ora...
entry.content:
Hello

There are many tutorial about connecting SAP System to BTP.

You are referring to the FIORI system, so do you want to move the frontend part to BTP only, or do you want to consume system data from BTP services (ECC or S4, for example)?

The basic steps for connecting a SAP system to the BTP cockpit involve using the SAP Cloud Connector. First, connect your SAP BTP cockpit to it and then your SAP system (don't forget to add resources)

On BTP Cockpit, you will then have to create a destination matching the virtual host you defined in SAP CC

Here is a guide (there are many others) https://learning.sap.com/courses/connecting-sap-btp-with-on-premise-via-cloud-connector

 

If you want to focus on Frontend things, then I would recommend exploring the SAP Build Workzone service. But you will also have to connect your SAP System first to your BTP cockpit to consume data

 

Best regards

entry.title: How to prevent the WDA-App EAMS_WDA_ORDNTF_OIF from showing an error-page after exception
entry.content:
Hi community,

I would like to share with you some functionality I used in my last S/4HANA 2022 Assetmanagement Project to prevent the WDA-App for maintaining orders (EAMS_WDA_ORDNTF_OIF) to lead to an error-page after occuring of an exception in UserExit or BADI during saving of the order.

When using the WebDynpro-App EAMS_WDA_ORDNTF_OIF (Maintain PM-Order) - raising an exception or sending an error-message
in UserExit IWO10009 "PM Order: Customer check for 'Save' Event"
or
in BADI WORKORDER_UPDATE Methode AT_SAVE
is a showstopper and will lead the user to an "Error-Page", not allowing to come back and work on the same data. Instead, all changes the user made are lost and the user has to start the app from the beginning:

 (This issue was told to SAP, but we got a negative answer and the problem seems not to be resolved in near time.)
For more information and the reason for this behavior you can read the comments in attachement "IWO10009_sample.txt" of SAP-Note "3092671 - Customer ConnectionImprovement Request D9817 - Implementation Example for User Exit IWO10009".

 

In SAPgui and WebGui, when an error occurred during saving of an order, we are used to come back to the app, being able to correct our entries.
The challenge was to find a workaround, to get the same behavior in the WebDynpro-App:

When saving an order in WDA, the method CALL_TRANSACTION_SAVE of the FloorPlanManager (Class CL_FPM) is called. It is devided into two parts:

First part: Standard-checks, making certain, that data is consistent.
Second part: Saving the order: BAPI "BAPI_ALM_ORDER_MAINTAIN" is called with method SAVE, that is calling UserExit IWO10009 and BADI WORKORDER_UPDATE Methode AT_SAVE. But this point is too late to come back to WDA-App, if a check fails.

Somewhere in or between these two parts, there is the "Point-Of-No-Return". If this is passed, a come back to the WDA-App is not possible:

 

So the idea is, to additionally implement the customer own checks within the first part.
Therefor the method CHECK_BEFORE_SAVE of class CL_EAMS_BO_ORDER seems to be the right one.
We added a small enhancement there at the end:

 

We decided to call here (inside the enhancement-method) the UserExit IWO10009 and BADI WORKORDER_UPDATE Methode AT_SAVE in general.
We wanted to have the same logic and checks in all UIs and a central message-handling in the UserExits and BADIs.
(It would also be possible, to call here just the UserExit or the BADI only or only one BADI-Implementation or even only a special method with custom specific checks.)


Occuring Messages have to be given back from the enhancement to the caller through exporting-parameter ET_MESSAGE of method CHECK_BEFORE_SAVE.

 

Here is the complete idea in steps:

  1. Create a custom class, e.g. "ZNIBADISEXITS".
  2. Within this class create a global attribut 'GT_RETURN' type bapirettab for passing the occuring messages from the UserExit and BADI to the WDA-App. 
  3. Create the following methods in your class, e.g. "ZNIBADISEXITS":
    • ENH_EAMSORDER__CHCKBEFSAVE_END (Static and Public)
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"Methoden Signatur:
*"  Importing
*"    MIT_NODE_DATA TYPE EAMS_T_BO_ORD_HEADER
*"  Changing
*"    MCT_MESSAGE TYPE /PLMB/T_SPI_MSG
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------

  METHOD enh_eamsorder__chckbefsave_end.
* Aufruf in CL_EAMS_BO_ORDER~CHECK_BEFORE_SAVE (Ende):
* Beim Sichern in der WebDynpro-Applikation zur Auftragsbearbeitung
* VOR Aufruf der Sicherungsroutinen.
* Funktionsweise:
* Aufruf des UserExits und des BADIs beim Sichern,
* um dortige kundeneigenen Pr√ºfungsroutinen VOR und nicht erst
* innerhalb der Sicherungsroutinen auszuf√ºhren.
* Fehlernachrichten k√∂nnen somit noch an die Applikation gereicht werden,
* ohne dass diese abbricht (auf die Error-Page f√ºhrt). Benutzer k√∂nnen
* dadurch ihre eingegebenen Daten noch korrigieren und erneut sichern.

    DATA: lt_caufvdb_new TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF caufvdb.
    DATA: lt_caufvdb_old TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF caufvdb.
    DATA: ls_caufvd_new  TYPE caufvd.
    DATA: ls_caufvd_old  TYPE caufvd.
    DATA: lv_trtyp       TYPE tc10-trtyp.
    DATA: lv_subrc       TYPE sy-subrc.
    DATA: lt_message     TYPE /plmb/t_spi_msg.

    FIELD-SYMBOLS <ls_node_data>     LIKE LINE OF mit_node_data.
    FIELD-SYMBOLS: <ls_caufvdb_new>  LIKE LINE OF lt_caufvdb_new.
    FIELD-SYMBOLS: <ls_caufvdb_old>  LIKE LINE OF lt_caufvdb_old.

***--- Auftr√§ge aus Belegtabellen einlesen
    cl_co_fm_access_factory=>cobh( )->co_bh_caufv_bt_fetch(
      IMPORTING
        et_caufv_bt     = lt_caufvdb_new
        et_caufv_bt_old = lt_caufvdb_old ).

***--- Auftragsweise Abarbeitung
    LOOP AT mit_node_data ASSIGNING <ls_node_data>.
**-- Aktuelle Auftragsdaten lesen
      READ TABLE lt_caufvdb_new ASSIGNING <ls_caufvdb_new> WITH KEY aufnr = <ls_node_data>-eams_aufnr.
      CHECK: sy-subrc IS INITIAL AND ( <ls_caufvdb_new>-vbkz = 'U' OR <ls_caufvdb_new>-vbkz = 'I' ).
      MOVE-CORRESPONDING <ls_caufvdb_new> TO ls_caufvd_new.
**-- "Alte" Auftragsdaten einlesen, falls vorhanden
      READ TABLE lt_caufvdb_old ASSIGNING <ls_caufvdb_old> WITH KEY aufnr = <ls_node_data>-eams_aufnr.
      IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
        MOVE-CORRESPONDING <ls_caufvdb_old> TO ls_caufvd_old.
      ELSE.
        MOVE-CORRESPONDING <ls_caufvdb_new> TO ls_caufvd_old.
      ENDIF.
**-- Bestimmung des Transaktionstyps je Auftrag aus dem Verbuchungskennzeichen
      CASE <ls_caufvdb_new>-vbkz.
        WHEN 'I'.
          lv_trtyp = 'H'.
        WHEN 'U'.
          lv_trtyp = 'V'.
      ENDCASE.
**-- Aufruf "UserExit beim Sichern"
      PERFORM user_exits_save IN PROGRAM saplcoih USING ls_caufvd_new ls_caufvd_old lv_trtyp lv_subrc.
*- Nachrichtenverarbeitung aus UserExit
      IF lv_subrc IS NOT INITIAL.
        CLEAR: lt_message.
        /plmb/cl_spi_appl_access_utils=>add_syst_message(
          CHANGING
            ct_message = lt_message ).
        APPEND LINES OF lt_message TO mct_message.
          CLEAR: lt_message.
          lt_message = znibadisexits=>glob_mess_give_2_spi( EXPORTING miv_do_init = 'X' ).
          APPEND LINES OF lt_message TO mct_message.
      ENDIF.
**-- Aufruf BADI "WORKORDER_UPDATE" Methode AT_SAVE
      DATA: lp_badi_if TYPE REF TO if_ex_workorder_update.
      CALL FUNCTION 'CO_BADI_GET_BUSINESS_ADD_IN'
        EXPORTING
          i_badi_name     = 'WORKORDER_UPDATE'
        CHANGING
          c_badi_instance = lp_badi_if
        EXCEPTIONS
          not_active      = 1
          OTHERS          = 2.
      IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
        CALL METHOD lp_badi_if->at_save
          EXPORTING
            is_header_dialog   = ls_caufvd_new
          EXCEPTIONS
            error_with_message = 1
            OTHERS             = 2.
*- Nachrichtenverarbeitung aus BADI
        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
          CLEAR: lt_message.
          /plmb/cl_spi_appl_access_utils=>add_syst_message(
            CHANGING
              ct_message = lt_message ).
          APPEND LINES OF lt_message TO mct_message.
          CLEAR: lt_message.
          lt_message = znibadisexits=>glob_mess_give_2_spi( EXPORTING miv_do_init = 'X' ).
          APPEND LINES OF lt_message TO mct_message.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

  ENDMETHOD.‚Äã
  • GLOB_MESS_GIVE_2_SPI  (Static and Protected)
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"Methoden Signatur:
*"  Importing
*"    MIV_DO_INIT TYPE FLAG
*"  Returning
*"     VALUE(MRT_MESSAGES_SPI) TYPE /PLMB/T_SPI_MSG
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------

  METHOD GLOB_MESS_GIVE_2_SPI.

    DATA: lt_message TYPE /plmb/t_spi_msg.

    FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_s_return> LIKE LINE OF gt_return.

    LOOP AT gt_return ASSIGNING <fs_s_return>.
      MESSAGE ID <fs_s_return>-id TYPE <fs_s_return>-type NUMBER <fs_s_return>-number
      WITH <fs_s_return>-message_v1 <fs_s_return>-message_v2
           <fs_s_return>-message_v3 <fs_s_return>-message_v4
      INTO sy-lisel.
      /plmb/cl_spi_appl_access_utils=>add_syst_message(
        EXPORTING
          iv_msg_index = <fs_s_return>-row
          iv_fieldname = <fs_s_return>-field
        CHANGING
          ct_message   = lt_message ).
    ENDLOOP.

    APPEND LINES OF lt_message TO mrt_messages_spi.

    CHECK: miv_do_init IS NOT INITIAL.
    CLEAR: gt_return.

  ENDMETHOD.‚Äã
  • ORDER_MESS_SHOW  (Static and Public)
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"Methoden Signatur:
*"  Importing
*"    MIT_RETURN TYPE BAPIRETTAB
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------

  METHOD ORDER_MESS_SHOW.

    FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_v_log_handle> TYPE balloghndl.
    FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_s_return> TYPE bapiret2.

    DATA: ls_keys_order TYPE cno1keys.

*- Nur wenn Nachrichten auszugeben sind
    CHECK: mit_return IS NOT INITIAL.

*- GUI-Typ ermitteln
    DATA(ls_gui) = znibadisexits=>xx_get_ui_type( ).
*- Wenn Order-BAPI aktiv ist, geht dessen Message-Handling vor, egal welcher GUI-Typ!
    CALL FUNCTION 'IBAPI_Z_GET_BAPI_FLAG'
      EXCEPTIONS
        bapi_active     = 1
        bapi_not_active = 2
        OTHERS          = 3.
    IF sy-subrc = 1.
      ls_gui-name = 'BAPI'.
    ENDIF.

    CASE ls_gui-name.
      WHEN 'WGU' OR 'HGU' OR 'BAT'.
        znibadisexits=>xx_mess_show_gui(
          EXPORTING
            mit_return = mit_return ).

      WHEN 'WDA' OR 'ODA' OR 'BSP' OR 'BAPI'.
***--- Pr√ºfungen
*- Pr√ºfen, ob Order-BAPI aktiv ist
        CALL FUNCTION 'IBAPI_Z_GET_BAPI_FLAG' "muss hier erneut gepr√ºft werden,
          EXCEPTIONS                          "da ENH CHECK_BEFORE_SAVE f√ºr WebDynpro
            bapi_active     = 1               "au√üerhalb des BAPIs l√§uft.
            bapi_not_active = 2               "Dort wird dann gt_return mit Methode
            OTHERS          = 3.              "GLOB_MESS_GIVE_2_SPI genutzt.
        IF sy-subrc = 1.
*- Pr√ºfen, ob Message-Handling des BAPIs aktiv ist
          ASSIGN ('(SAPLIBAPI_Z)GV_LOG_HANDLE') TO <fs_v_log_handle>.
          IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL AND <fs_v_log_handle> IS NOT INITIAL.
***--- Ausf√ºhrung
*- √úbergeben der Messages aus SYST an das Appl.Log des BAPIs
            LOOP AT mit_return ASSIGNING <fs_s_return>.
              CLEAR: ls_keys_order.
              IF <fs_s_return>-parameter IS NOT INITIAL.
                IF <fs_s_return>-parameter(4) = 'AUFK'.
                  ls_keys_order = <fs_s_return>-parameter+4.
                ENDIF.
              ENDIF.
              MESSAGE ID <fs_s_return>-id TYPE <fs_s_return>-type NUMBER <fs_s_return>-number
              WITH <fs_s_return>-message_v1 <fs_s_return>-message_v2
                   <fs_s_return>-message_v3 <fs_s_return>-message_v4
              INTO sy-lisel.
              CALL FUNCTION 'IBAPI_Z_MSG_STORE'
                EXPORTING
                  iv_aufnr = ls_keys_order-aufnr
                  iv_vornr = ls_keys_order-activity
                  iv_uvorn = ls_keys_order-sub_activity
                  iv_repid = sy-repid.
            ENDLOOP.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
        IF <fs_v_log_handle> IS NOT ASSIGNED.      "BAPI-Flag ist nicht aktiv oder LOG_HANDLE war nicht gesetzt
          APPEND LINES OF mit_return TO gt_return. "=> Nachrichten global speichern, k√∂nnen dann abgeholt werden,
        ENDIF.                                     " z.B. bzw. siehe Methode GLOB_MESS_GIVE_2_SPI

      WHEN 'BNP'.
        LOOP AT mit_return ASSIGNING <fs_s_return>.
          MESSAGE ID <fs_s_return>-id TYPE <fs_s_return>-type NUMBER <fs_s_return>-number
          WITH <fs_s_return>-message_v1 <fs_s_return>-message_v2
               <fs_s_return>-message_v3 <fs_s_return>-message_v4.
        ENDLOOP.

      WHEN OTHERS.
    ENDCASE.

  ENDMETHOD.‚Äã
  • XX_GET_UI_TYPE  (Static and Public)
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"Methoden Signatur:
*"  Returning
*"     VALUE(MES_GUI) TYPE IHTTPNVP
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------

  METHOD xx_get_ui_type.

*-- HGU - Html SAP GUI
    DATA: lv_its_active TYPE flag.
    CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_IS_ITS'
      IMPORTING
        return = lv_its_active.
    IF lv_its_active IS NOT INITIAL.
      mes_gui-name  = 'HGU'.
      mes_gui-value = 'Html SAP GUI' ##NO_TEXT.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

*- BatchInput (muss vor WGU stehen!)
    IF sy-binpt IS NOT INITIAL.
      mes_gui-name  = 'BNP'.
      mes_gui-value = 'BatchInput' ##NO_TEXT.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

*-- WGU - Windows SAP GUI
    DATA: lv_gui_active TYPE flag.
    CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_IS_AVAILABLE'
      IMPORTING
        return = lv_gui_active.
    IF lv_gui_active IS NOT INITIAL.
      mes_gui-name  = 'WGU'.
      mes_gui-value = 'Windows SAP GUI' ##NO_TEXT.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

*-- BSP - Business Server Pages
    DATA(lr_bsp_server) = cl_bsp_runtime=>if_bsp_runtime~server.
    IF lr_bsp_server IS BOUND.
      mes_gui-name  = 'BSP'.
      mes_gui-value = 'Business Server Pages' ##NO_TEXT.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

*-- WDA - WebDynpro for ABAP
    DATA(lr_wd_server) = wdr_task=>server.
    IF lr_wd_server IS BOUND.
      mes_gui-name  = 'WDA'.
      mes_gui-value = 'WebDynpro ABAP' ##NO_TEXT.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

*-- ODA - oData (Fiori, ...)
    DATA(lo_batch_helper) = /iwfnd/cl_mgw_batch_helper=>get_batch_helper( ). "wird angelegt, wenn nicht aktiv!
    lo_batch_helper->batch_get_service_name_version(                         "Daher keine Pr√ºfung 'IS BOUND'n√∂tig
      IMPORTING
        ev_service_name    = DATA(lv_service_name)
        ev_service_version = DATA(lv_service_version)
    ).
    IF lv_service_name IS NOT INITIAL.
      mes_gui-name  = 'ODA'.
      mes_gui-value = 'oData (Fiori, ...)' ##NO_TEXT.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

*-- Hintergrundverarbeitung (Job/...)
    IF sy-batch IS NOT INITIAL.
      mes_gui-name  = 'BAT'.
      mes_gui-value = 'batch / background' ##NO_TEXT.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

*-- damit Exporting-Parameter immer gef√ºllt ist und mit Offset(3) abgefragt werden kann
    mes_gui-name  = 'OTH'.
    mes_gui-value = 'others / unknown' ##NO_TEXT.

  ENDMETHOD.‚Äã
  • XX_MESS_SHOW_GUI  (Static and Public)
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"Methoden Signatur:
*"  Importing
*"    MIT_RETURN TYPE BAPIRETTAB
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------

  METHOD xx_mess_show_gui.

    DATA: lv_mess_ident TYPE sy-uzeit.

    FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_s_return> TYPE bapiret2.
    FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_v_ident>  TYPE sy-uzeit.

***--- StartChecks
*- Nur wenn Nachrichten auszugeben sind
    CHECK: mit_return IS NOT INITIAL.
*- Nicht bei BatchInput
    CHECK: sy-binpt IS INITIAL.
*- GUI-Typ ermitteln -> Nur bei WinGUI und HtmlGUI Nachrichten hier anzeigen.
    DATA(ls_gui) = znibadisexits=>xx_get_ui_type( ).
    CHECK: ls_gui-name = 'WGU' OR ls_gui-name = 'HGU' OR ls_gui-name = 'BAT'.

***--- Preparation
*- Pr√ºfen, ob Message-Handler bereits aktiv ist
    CALL FUNCTION 'MESSAGES_ACTIVE'
      EXCEPTIONS
        not_active = 1
        OTHERS     = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      ASSIGN ('(SAPLSMSG)GD_IDENT') TO <fs_v_ident>.
      IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
        lv_mess_ident = <fs_v_ident>.
      ENDIF.
*- Message-Handler ggf. aktivieren
      CALL FUNCTION 'MESSAGES_INITIALIZE'
        EXPORTING
          i_store_duplicates    = 'X'
          i_identification      = lv_mess_ident
          i_allow_foreign_reset = 'X'
        IMPORTING
          e_identification      = lv_mess_ident
        EXCEPTIONS
          log_not_active        = 1
          wrong_identification  = 2
          OTHERS                = 0.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*        nothing to do here
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.

***--- Execution
*- Message an Message-Handler geben
    LOOP AT mit_return ASSIGNING <fs_s_return>.
      CALL FUNCTION 'MESSAGE_STORE'
        EXPORTING
          arbgb                   = <fs_s_return>-id
          exception_if_not_active = ' '
          msgty                   = <fs_s_return>-type
          msgv1                   = <fs_s_return>-message_v1
          msgv2                   = <fs_s_return>-message_v2
          msgv3                   = <fs_s_return>-message_v3
          msgv4                   = <fs_s_return>-message_v4
          txtnr                   = <fs_s_return>-number
        EXCEPTIONS
          message_type_not_valid  = 1
          not_active              = 2
          OTHERS                  = 3.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*        nothing to do here
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
*- Messages ausgeben
    CALL FUNCTION 'MESSAGES_SHOW'
      EXCEPTIONS
        inconsistent_range = 1
        no_messages        = 2
        OTHERS             = 3.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*        nothing to do here
    ENDIF.

***--- PostProcessing
*- Sammeln von Nachrichten beenden
    IF lv_mess_ident IS NOT INITIAL.
      CALL FUNCTION 'MESSAGES_STOP'
        EXPORTING
          i_identification  = lv_mess_ident
          i_reset_messages  = 'X'
        EXCEPTIONS
          a_message         = 1
          e_message         = 2
          w_message         = 3
          i_message         = 4
          s_message         = 5
          deactivated_by_md = 6
          OTHERS            = 7.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*        nothing to do here
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.

  ENDMETHOD.‚Äã
  • BADI_WUPD__AT_SAVE  (Static and Public)
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"Methoden Signatur:
*"  Changing
*"    MCS_CAUFVD TYPE CAUFVD
*"  Exception 
*"    ERROR_WITH_MESSAGE
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------

  METHOD badi_wupd__at_save.
DATA: lt_return TYPE bapirettab.


* ...
* Implement your custom checks here and collect messages in table lt_return,
* you can use CALL FUNCTION 'BALW_BAPIRETURN_GET2' ... to do that.
* ...


**-- Message-Handling
    znibadisexits=>order_mess_show( EXPORTING mit_return = lt_return ).
    TRY.
        DATA(ls_return) = lt_return[ type = 'E' ].
        MESSAGE e005(zli_iwoc) RAISING error_with_message.
*      "Beim Speichern wurde ein Fehler gefunden"
      CATCH cx_sy_itab_line_not_found.
    ENDTRY.

  ENDMETHOD.‚Äã
  • USEREXIT_IWO10009 (Static and Public)
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"Methoden Signatur:
*"  Importing
*"    MIS_CAUFVD TYPE CAUFVD
*"    MIV_TRTYP TYPE TRTYP
*"  Changing
*"    MCV_RELEASE_ORDER TYPE XFLAG
*"  Exception
*"    ERROR_WITH_MESSAGE 
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------

  METHOD userexit_iwo10009.
    DATA:       lt_return TYPE bapirettab.


* ...
* Implement your custom checks here and collect messages in table lt_return,
* you can use CALL FUNCTION 'BALW_BAPIRETURN_GET2' ... to do that.
* ...


*- Nachrichten- und Ausnahmen-Handling
    znibadisexits=>order_mess_show( EXPORTING mit_return = lt_return ).
    IF line_exists( lt_return[ type = 'E' ] ).
      CHECK: mis_caufvd-abruf_flag IS INITIAL AND ( mis_caufvd-wo_flag IS INITIAL OR miv_trtyp = 'V' ).
      MESSAGE e084(iw) RAISING error_with_message.
*     "Der Auftrag soll nicht gesichert werden (festgelegt durch Customer-Exit)"
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.‚Äã

 

Additionally implement the following:

  • Implement Include ZXWOCU07 (UserExit IWO10009)
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Include          ZXWOCU07
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"*"Lokale Schnittstelle:
*"  IMPORTING
*"     VALUE(CAUFVD_IMP) LIKE  CAUFVD STRUCTURE  CAUFVD
*"     VALUE(TRTYP) LIKE  TC10-TRTYP
*"  EXPORTING
*"     REFERENCE(RELEASE_ORDER) TYPE  XFLAG
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
znibadisexits=>userexit_iwo10009( EXPORTING  mis_caufvd         = caufvd_imp
                                             miv_trtyp          = trtyp
                                  CHANGING   mcv_release_order  = release_order
                                  EXCEPTIONS error_with_message = 1
                                             OTHERS             = 2 ).
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
  IF sy-msgid IS NOT INITIAL AND sy-msgty IS NOT INITIAL.
    RAISE error_with_message.
  ELSE.
    MESSAGE e079(iw) RAISING error_with_message.
*     "Sichern wurde vom System zur√ºckgewiesen"
  ENDIF.
ENDIF.‚Äã
  • Implement Method IF_EX_WORKORDER_UPDATE~AT_SAVE in your own Implementation of BADI WORKORDER_UPDATE.
  METHOD if_ex_workorder_update~at_save.
*@78\QImporting@	IS_HEADER_DIALOG	TYPE COBAI_S_HEADER_DIALOG	Auftragskopf in Dialogstruktur
*@03\QException@	ERROR_WITH_MESSAGE		Fehlermeldung aufgetreten

    DATA: ls_caufvd TYPE caufvd.

    MOVE-CORRESPONDING is_header_dialog TO ls_caufvd.

    znibadisexits=>badi_wupd__at_save(
      CHANGING
        mcs_caufvd         = ls_caufvd
      EXCEPTIONS
        error_with_message = 1
        OTHERS             = 2 ).
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      IF sy-msgid IS NOT INITIAL AND sy-msgty IS NOT INITIAL.
        RAISE error_with_message.
      ELSE.
        MESSAGE e079(iw) RAISING error_with_message.
*       "Sichern wurde vom System zur√ºckgewiesen"
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.

  ENDMETHOD.‚Äã
  • Implement an enhancement at the end of Method CHECK_BEFORE_SAVE of class CL_EAMS_BO_ORDER
"""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""$"$\SE:(1) Klasse CL_EAMS_BO_ORDER, Methode CHECK_BEFORE_SAVE, Ende                                                                                          A
*$*$-Start: (1)---------------------------------------------------------------------------------$*$*
ENHANCEMENT 1  ZNIEAMSORDER_CHECKBEFSAVE.    "active version
    znibadisexits=>enh_eamsorder__chckbefsave_end(
      EXPORTING
        mit_node_data = lt_node_data
      CHANGING
        mct_message   = et_message ).
ENDENHANCEMENT.
*$*$-End:   (1)---------------------------------------------------------------------------------$*$*
‚Äã

 

As a result, when errors occur during saving of an order in WDA, the user is led back to the WDA-App and the messages are displayed:

 The UserExit and the BADI are now called once within the first part of saving (before POINT OF NO RETURN) by custom logic and once after it by SAP-Standard logic:

 


Important point:
As we decided later, not to use WDA-Apps in productive system at all due to several reasons, this solution is not deeply testet, yet.
Please be careful and check each and every step to meet your requirements.

Another important point:
Due to SAP-Note 3092671, it is possible, to change the order within UserExit IWO10009 during saving by using function modules IBAPI_.... . If you already do that and as this UserExit and BADI WORKORDER_UPDATE~AT_SAVE are now passed at least two times during one save from WDA, you should carefully review your custom logic regarding this. 

 

Here are two articles I wrote some time ago regarding two methods that I use above:

"How to identify the actually used UserInterface Technology from ABAP"
https://community.sap.com/t5/blogs/blogworkflowpage/blog-id/technology-blog-members/article-id/166951

"How to pass multiple messages from ABAP (Exit/BADI) to the UserInterfaces in S/4HANA-Assetmanagement"
https://community.sap.com/t5/blogs/blogworkflowpage/blog-id/technology-blog-members/article-id/166956

Maybe these articles are of interest for you, too.

We may incorporate 'manual paper-based (Demand Approval) process' in the PR release strategy.

entry.title: Demystifying SAP Commerce Cloud Search Services A Practical Overview
entry.content:
Moving from Solr to a Cloud-Native Future

In modern e-commerce, search drives conversions. Customers expect instant, relevant results ‚Äî whether they‚Äôre browsing, comparing, or buying.

For years, SAP Commerce Cloud relied on Apache Solr to power search and navigation. It was reliable but required manual management, infrastructure maintenance, and tuning.

To simplify and modernize, SAP introduced Search Services, a fully managed, cloud-native search solution that replaces embedded Solr.

This post gives a business and architectural overview of SAP Commerce Cloud Search Services, what it is, why it matters, and how it changes the way enterprises handle product discovery.

üîç What Is SAP Commerce Cloud Search Services?

Search Services is SAP‚Äôs new Software-as-a-Service offering. It replaces the legacy Solr-based search engine with a scalable, API-driven platform hosted and managed by SAP.

Instead of running Solr inside your Commerce environment, your storefront interacts with a dedicated Search API for indexing and queries.

Key benefits:

  • No infrastructure management ‚Äî SAP handles uptime, scaling, and upgrades.
  • Decoupled architecture ‚Äî search runs independently of Commerce nodes.
  • Improved stability and automatic scaling for high-traffic sites.


üí° Why SAP Moved Beyond Solr

The shift from Solr to Search Services is about scalability, agility, and cloud readiness.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Cloud Scalability

  • Then: Solr scaled with Commerce(solr) nodes; more users meant more infrastructure.
  • Now: Search Services scales independently, managed entirely by SAP.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Zero Maintenance

  • No need for schema.xml or manual Solr tuning.
  • Updates and patches are automatic, with near-zero downtime.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Business Agility

Search Services integrates tightly with Adaptive Search in Backoffice, empowering business users to manage:

  • Facets and filters
  • Boosting and burying
  • Hero products
  • Synonyms and stop words

üß± Core Architectural Concepts

üîó 1. Decoupled Data Flow

  1. Commerce pushes product data to Search Services.
  2. The service indexes and optimizes search data.
  3. Storefront queries go directly to the Search API.
  4. Results return product IDs, which Commerce renders.

‚öôÔ∏è 2. Search Profiles

Search Profiles define how data is indexed and displayed. They include:

  • Facets and sorting options
  • Synonyms and stop words
  • Boost and bury rules
  • Campaign-specific settings

You can maintain separate profiles for live, staging, or marketing campaigns, allowing quick swaps without redeployments.

üß© 3. Adaptive Search Integration

Adaptive Search remains the front-end for configuration. Business users can visually adjust relevance and sorting, no code changes needed.

üß† Key Capabilities

üî∏ Business Features

  • Boost/Bury/Hero Products ‚Äî Control product ranking.
  • Facets and Filters ‚Äî Define storefront filtering.
  • Synonyms and Stop Words ‚Äî Improve multilingual search accuracy.
  • Autocomplete & Suggestions ‚Äî Delivered through dedicated APIs.

üî∏ Technical Features

  • REST APIs for indexing and querying.
  • Cloud-native architecture managed by SAP.
  • JSON Import/Export for version-controlled configurations.
  • High availability and multi-tenant reliability.

üìà Benefits for Business and IT

üöÄ 1. Scalable and Reliable

  • Cloud-managed performance and availability.
  • Independent scaling for high-volume catalogs.

üë©‚Äçüíº 2. Empowered Business Teams

  • Manage ranking, facets, and synonyms without developer help.
  • Faster campaign changes and seasonal updates.

üîß 3. Reduced IT Effort

  • No Solr maintenance, tuning, or patching.
  • Lower total cost of ownership.

üß† 4. Future-Ready

  • Built for integration with AI and personalization services.
  • Prepares enterprises for headless and composable architectures.

üèÅ Conclusion

The shift from embedded Solr to SAP Commerce Cloud Search Services is more than an architectural upgrade. It is a fundamental pivot toward the future of digital commerce.

In an era where customer expectations are constantly evolving, businesses can no longer afford to be tethered to the operational complexities of legacy search.

By decoupling search and embracing a cloud-native model, organizations are not just optimizing performance, but they are unlocking the strategic agility required to innovate.

This is the foundation upon which next-generation, AI-driven personalization will be built.

Ultimately, adopting Search Services is a declaration that you are choosing to lead in the digital marketplace, not just compete in it.

SAP Commerce Cloud SAP Cloud for Customer core applications

entry.title: Re: AWS Route 53 setup for multiple Hana Cloud instances...
entry.content:
I've created a new instance in the same region, and the service endpoint ID was the same. Which means, doing a wildcard like *.hana.prod-us10.hanacloud.ondemand.com works just fine because it's all going to the same endpoint.

It's still a problem for hana-free instances, given they don't support private link, but I guess I can just run those in a different region.

entry.title: Re: How to get import error logs in HANA Cloud?
entry.content: In case it helps anyone, my current workaround is to create a sql-on-files external table, and doing an upsert instead.

entry.title: Re: Creation of OBD automatically for the Subcon PO
entry.content:
Hi @i_am_mazahar 
If you are already following the OBD process, you may automate VL10B with required variant parameters and create background job with required time interval (each 15 mins or 1 hour etc).

If the posting is not happening, we may need to include the posting program along with VL10B in the background job. Please consult with technical team(ABAP) to find the required programs, Also it is always suggestable to include posting/error log details in the Background job.

Thanks.

entry.title: Re: üì¢ Survey: ABAP Naming Conventions
entry.content: @kilian_kilger : My two cents. Proximity is important so I would prefer compiler level check when activating the code, as  other checks would come quite late in the development process.

entry.title: Re: 403 Forbidden error on consuming CAPM API in a Custom SAPUI5 project
entry.content: Did u get solution to the problem, we are also fascing same issue. CAP service works fine when deployed. Works fine from postman. Only when added in SAPUI5 using destination s it gives 403 forbidden error. Do let know if u got solution. Thanks.

entry.title: Re: Devtoberfest 2025 by the Numbers: Engagement, Badges, and Top Achievers
entry.content: Hi @Marian_Zeis , I followed https://devtoberfest.marianzeis.de/?scnId=186716 for all points. currently nothing is pending. I am not sure where I missed 500 Points. Please help.

entry.title: Re: Why SAP Crystal Reports Viewer doesn't support Window...
entry.content:
POC from your original post (PrintOutputController) not PrintToPrinter

Sorry: Edited it. It should be POC not P2C that I mentioned. Yes its PrintOutputController new print mode from Crystal Reports.

 I try PrintOutputController. it only give custom crystal reports Print Dialog not windows 11 Print Dialog. So the PrintToPrinter is give a Windows 11 Dialog. but Crystal Reports doesn't support Windows 11 New Print Preview Dialog.  

I don't know if this issue belong to Windows 11 itself. Because Native apps doesn't support this feature also.

I also try from Notepad.exe

Same for Paint.exe

I assume Windows 11 Print Preview dialog. confuses users.

many customers think the problem from crystal reports. IDK why actually Microsoft Windows added new print preview dialog?

Or if Crystal Reports can support it will be great for non technical users.

entry.title: SAP Datasphere News in October
entry.content:
SAP Datasphere News in October

Another month with a great new release delivery ‚ú®

Learn more in my short top features video in October2025 on YouTube üì∫ also including an outlook at SAP TechEd session this year.

In addition, explore the latest updates in our community news blogs and more.

 

My top features in October

 

Impact of Changes in the Source Objects of an Analytic Model

Changing, saving, and re-deploying a data builder object again will trigger a status change of any analytic model that uses that object. The analytic model status will change to either ‚ÄúChanges to Deploy‚Äù or ‚ÄúDesign Time Error‚Äù, depending on which change has been made (compatible or incompatible changes). This gives you better transparency in change control handling of your models.

 

Converting a Data Flow Into a Replication Flow and/or Transformation Flow

When your data flow is eligible to be converted into a transformation flow or a replication flow coupled with a transformation flow, a banner will be displayed in the data flow editor. Using a replication flow and/or a transformation flow will allow you to benefit from improved connectivity, access to delta load processing, and enhanced resiliency and scalability.
‚û°Ô∏è   More information

 

Technical User to Manage Tasks via CLI

You can now use OAuth clients with the technical user purpose to manage tasks via the command line interface based on the roles and spaces you assign to the client.
‚û°Ô∏è   More information.

 

 

 

SAP TechEd 2025

There are many sessions about SAP Business Data Cloud and also SAP Datasphere at SAP TechEd 2025. Some are part of the virtual TechEd and others like for instance the onsite hands-on sessions are exclusive for people attending in Berlin.

 

 

My favorite blogs in October

My colleague @Max_Gander wrote two nice blogs about the new feature with live versions in planning, which I think is a one of the best features I have seen all next to seamless planning itself:
‚û°Ô∏è   Live Versions from an SQL Source for SAP Analytics Cloud Planning
‚û°Ô∏è   Unlocking the Next Chapter of Seamless Planning in SAP Business Data Cloud with Live Versions

 

People Intelligence is one of the latest applications offered as part of SAP Business Data Cloud. @blberger has written a informative blog about its general availability and offers many useful links to further details about this offering:
‚û°Ô∏è   Maximize the value of HR data ‚Äì Introducing People Intelligence
@VenkatPSis looking at the same topic from a use case perspective and explains the problems which can be solved using this application:
‚û°Ô∏è   People Intelligence in SAP Business Data Cloud is Generally Available!

 

@hozumihighlight another interesting capability we recently delivered as part of SAP BDC, which is called BDC Connect and it helps expand the zero copy delta sharing to external systems: 
‚û°Ô∏è   SAP BDC Connect: SAP elevates bidirectional zero-copy data sharing with game-changing partnerships

 

Keep on brining these valuable blogs @FernandaFroelich. On the one hand she extend her blog series on SAP Databricks by looking more detailed on user and roles with Databricks:

On the other hand, she helps you to better understand the consumption monitoring in SAP BDC:

entry.title: A clear guide to understanding how SAP MDG prioritizes UI layers‚Äîstandard, CBA, customization, and e
entry.content:
When working with SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), it‚Äôs common to face situations where a field behaves differently than expected ‚Äî maybe it‚Äôs hidden for one user role but visible for another, or a layout change doesn‚Äôt appear. These issues often come down to how different UI layers interact with each other.

To make sense of it, let‚Äôs walk through how SAP MDG decides which configuration takes effect when you use standard setup, CBA, customization, and enhancements.

Standard Configuration ‚Äì The Starting Point

Every MDG screen begins with the standard SAP configuration. This includes the delivered Floorplan Manager (FPM) setup, feeder classes, and event logic. Think of this as the foundation. Everything else ‚Äî from customizations to enhancements ‚Äî builds on top of it.

Context-Based Adaptation (CBA)

CBA allows you to adapt the UI depending on the context ‚Äî such as a business role, change request type, or entity type. If more than one CBA applies, the system picks the one with the highest priority (defined by the lowest numeric value in customizing). CBA runs before any runtime logic and overrides the standard configuration. It‚Äôs the best option when you want different screens or layouts for different user roles or processes.

UI Customization

Once the relevant configuration (standard or CBA) is loaded, the system applies any UI customizations you‚Äôve made. These are the changes you do in the FPM configuration editor ‚Äî for example, hiding a field, changing labels, or adjusting layout groups. If both a CBA and a customization touch the same field, the CBA takes priority because it decides which version of the configuration is active.

UI Enhancements

After all the configuration-based layers are applied, enhancements come into play. These are ABAP-based runtime changes done through custom logic or BadIs. Enhancements have the highest priority because they run at runtime and can override anything set in configuration or CBA. For example, even if a field is hidden in CBA, an enhancement can make it visible again based on business rules.

Summary of Priority

Priority| Layer| What It Does

  1. (Lowest)| Standard Configuration: SAP-delivered default setup
  2. CBA: Adjusts UI based on context (role, CR type, etc.)
  3. UI Customization: Static FPM-level changes
  4. (Highest)| UI Enhancements: Dynamic ABAP logic at runtime

 

Best Practice:

  1. Use CBA for context-based variations (like role or process-specific screens).
  2. Use UI Customization for layout or field visibility changes that stay constant.
  3. Use Enhancements for dynamic, condition-based logic at runtime.

 

Understanding this order helps avoid conflicts between configurations and ensures your MDG UI behaves consistently. It also makes your design easier to maintain and extend as your governance processes evolve.

entry.title: GRC Tuesdays: What's New in SAP Risk and Assurance Management, Q4 2025
entry.content:
As I am sure you are already well aware, if you want to be amongst the first to know what is new within SAP Risk and Assurance Management, all the information is just one click away in the dedicated section of the product Help Portal.

In these GRC Tuesdays blog, we take a different angle: we don‚Äôt provide an exhaustive list, instead, we just make a focus on certain capabilities that we think can spark your interest.

Working with Claudia Behrendt and Alain-Brieuc Gall from SAP Product Management, we have decided to highlight 2 new enhancements delivered recently in SAP Risk and Assurance Management:

  • New integrated reporting dashboards in Enterprise SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)
  • Predicted Conclusions in the Issue Management and Remediation service

 

New integrated reporting dashboards in Enterprise SAP Analytics Cloud

 

By leveraging the SAP Analytics Cloud stories, users of SAP Risk and Assurance Management can significantly improve their master data compliance and risk management processes, leading to enhanced efficiency, reduced risks, and a more robust assurance framework.

To support this objective the team has released a new SAC story:

Risk & Assurance Management Cockpit

This new dashboard increases transparency for Compliance executives as it provides them with a cockpit-like experience with actionable insights derived from visual and comparative analysis of compliance data. It helps in identifying patterns, tracking performance over time, and prioritizing efforts effectively.

This comprehensive view enhances the organization‚Äôs ability to manage risks and assurance activities, ultimately leading to better compliance and operational excellence.

This SAP Analytics Cloud story includes the following visualisations:

Instant Overview

 

 

Provides an immediate snapshot of compliance issues, organized by type and status, with visual charts that display trends over time.

Efficiency Metrics

 

 

Offers insights into average issue resolution times and year-to-year analysis, helping to identify process inefficiencies.

 Comparative Analysis

 

 

Makes it easy to compare current performance and highlights long-term trends and deviations, facilitating informed decision-making.

 

Controls Compliance Dashboard

And, in case you missed the information or simply forgot about it, allow me to refresh your memory: there is already another SAC story previously available: the Controls Compliance Dashboard.

With this dashboard, users to have a granular view of their compliance posture, ensuring that all necessary controls are in place and that data integrity is maintained. It helps them identify potential risks early and taking proactive measures to mitigate them, thereby enhancing overall operational efficiency and compliance readiness.

The SAP Analytics Cloud stories in this dashboard are based on information from the controls‚Äô master data and associated run results:

Compliance Coverage

 

 

Helps to understand the compliance coverage of controls, ensuring that all critical areas are adequately monitored.

Master Data Completeness

 

 

Assesses the completeness of master data across the controls, identifying any gaps or discrepancies that need attention.

Data Hygiene

 

 

Highlights data holes and orphaned data, facilitating timely data completion or clean-up efforts to maintain accuracy and relevance.

 Complementary Insights

 

 

Complements the Fiori apps but provides additional, in-depth insights not available in the standard apps.

 Compliance Status

 

 

Offers a comprehensive view of the compliance status of controls across organizations, processes, and regulations, with dedicated KPIs.

 Failure Analysis

 

 

Shows which and how many controls fail at any given time and over time, across various dimensions, including automated and manual procedures.

 

Predicted Conclusions in the Issue Management and Remediation service

 

Shifting gear from reporting to workflows, with decision support for issues with Machine Learning, organizations can benefit from predictive model to automate decision-making and speed up issue processing. The model uses historical decisions to predict outcomes for new issues.

Compliance specialists are often faced with numerous issues raised that they need to quickly review and categorize so that they are addressed in time by relevant stakeholders.

If this is a key aspect of their role ‚Äì especially when new types of issues arise that would require expert review, many issues are quite ‚Äústandard‚Äù and decisions can be streamlined by an intelligent engine: confirm the issue and assign it for remediation or close it as a false positive.

This is precisely what this capability offers: to serve as an enabler for further automation steps for issue processing.

Based on previous manual decisions for related issues, SAP Risk and Assurance Management can generate an automated conclusion and display its level of confidence:

  

More information

 

Should you be interested in drilling-down further here, then I would suggest the following links:

  • What's New in SAP Risk and Assurance Management ‚Äì the single source of truth for what has been released
  •  SAP Road Map Explorer ‚Äì the single source of truth, but this time for what is planned to be released!
  • Risk and Compliance Cockpit ‚Äì for more granular details on this new SAP Analytics Cloud story

We hope this was useful. Keep an eye open for our next blogs in the What's New in SAP Risk and Assurance Management series. In the meantime, I look forward to reading your thoughts and comments on this blog.

And if you are interested in learning more about SAP solutions for Governance, Risk, and Compliance, feel free to fill-in the demo request form!

entry.title: Re: Payroll EG Issue ‚Äì Need to Process Salaries in Non-EG...
entry.content:
For your case, I recommend:

  1. Clone the Egypt schema (E0) ‚Üí Create custom schema ZPYXX.
  2. In the new schema, remove or bypass any conversion rules forcing EGP.
  3. Add a rule or custom function to fetch company code currency dynamically (via feature or table lookup).
  4. Adjust posting rules in PCP0 to post results in the same currency.
  5. Test with employees from different company codes (USD, KES, etc.) and confirm correct currency flow from payroll to posting.

    Area

    Table / Transaction

    Purpose

    Company currency

    OBY6

    Defines currency per company code

    Payroll area / schema

    PE01 / PE02

    Review schema and rules for hardcoded currency

    Constants / conversion

    V_T511K

    Country-specific constants

    Currency conversion

    OB08

    Exchange rate setup

    Posting config

    PCP0 / T52EK / T52EZ

    Control posting and currency logic

    User exits

    EXIT_RPCALE00_001, EXIT_RPCIPE00_001

    Enhance payroll or posting logic
